They've been subbing since the show started broadcasting, with karaoke. The translations are somewhat adjusted for culture yet still retain the original meaning. Also random superficial touches like colored text.
Video/audio quality is great, and they casualise the subs, too--making them sound appropriate to context and not so awkward too (could you imagine most of the characters speaking entirely formally?)
Slow, but with great quality. Translations, that are actually correct... worth the wait!

Awful. Those saying otherwise can't understand Japanese. And it's awful because the translator said (on AniDB) he translates the show based on Chinese subs. So the dialogue has probably been mistranslated before the English translation even starts. Awful.
